a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: Also called a multiway tree, a B-tree is a fast data-indexing method that organizes the index into a multi-level set of nodes. Each node contains a sorted array of key values (the indexed data). Two important properties of a B-tree are that all nodes are at least half-full and that the tree is always balanced (that is, an identical number of nodes must be read in order to locate all keys at any given level in the tree). A well-organized B-tree will have only three or four levels.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: An in-memory store of data read from a disk file, in which database operations are performed.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A set of buffers used to optimize database input and output operations. All RDM Embedded database input and output is performed using a cache.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The concatenation of the members of two or more set types into one set type.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The point at which database changes made during a single transaction are actually written to the database files.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A key field composed of any combination of fields (not necessarily contiguous) from a record. Each field of a compound key may be stored in ascending or descending order.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The process of inserting a member record occurrence into a set occurrence.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A table of database addresses maintained by the RDM Embedded runtime system for controlling record access and set navigation. The currency tables consist of the current member table, current owner table, and the current record.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The database that is currently accessible by the RDM Embedded runtime functions when multiple databases have been opened. The current database is changed by the database number function argument or by function d_setdb.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: Contains, for each set, the database address of a record occurrence that is a valid member of that set. Usually, the current member of a set is the last record accessed using a set navigation function (d_findfm, d_findlm, d_findnm, or d_findpm).

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: Contains for each set, the database address of a record occurrence that is a valid owner of that set. Usually, the current owner of a set is established using the set navigation function d_findco or by using a currency manipulation function.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: Contains the database address of the most recently accessed record instance.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A field represents the basic unit of information storage in a database and is always defined to be an element of a record. A field has associated with it attributes such as name, type (for example, char or int), and length. Other terms used for field include: attribute, entity, or column.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: An RDM Embedded file defined in a DDL specification that contains occurrences of one or more record types.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: An organized collection of related files.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The location in the database of a record occurrence, frequently referred to as a DB_ADDR. Composed of two numbers: the file index and the slot within the file. Either 4 or 8 bytes long.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A programming-like language used to define the structure and content of a database. RDM Embedded's Database Definition Language has been designed to be used with the C programming language.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A programming-like language used to define the structure and content of a database. RDM Embedded's Database Definition Language has been designed to be used with the C programming language.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A situation in which multiple processes accessing the same database each hold locks needed by the other processes in such a way that none of the processes can proceed. Sometimes called deadly embrace.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A linked list containing deleted records or nodes to be reused when a new record or node is created.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A revision that can be derived from a comparison of the source and destination database dictionary files.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The db_REVISE-created database that stores the specified revisions.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A repository containing a definition of the content and structure of a database. It is used by the RDM Embedded runtime library functions for accessing and manipulating information from that database.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The process of removing a member record from a set occurrence.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The path to the directory under which all files will be stored. Within the domain of one TFS, no files outside of this path may be accessed.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The "name" of a computer which has visibility to another computer. This may be a published name available on DNS servers and across the Internet, or an internal network name visible only within a workgroup. The "ping" utility must be able to locate the IP address associated with this name. In RDM Embedded, a server (tfserver, dbmirror, dbrep, or dbrepsql) may be located through the domain name of the computer it is running on, together with the port on which it is listening. A special domain name, "localhost" always refers to the same computer as the application is running on (IP address is always 127.0.0.1).

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A programmer-specified operating system parameter that is used to identify configuration information to the runtime system.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A field represents the basic unit of information storage in a database and is always defined to be an element of a record. A field has associated with it attributes such as name, type (for example, char or int), and length. Other terms used for field include: attribute, entity, or column.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The primary physical storage unit into which a database is organized. In RDM Embedded, files are used to store records and keys.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A data representation in which the relationships between record types are formed from parent-child structures, such that a record type may have many child relationships but only one parent relationship.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A set of key values through which rapid retrieval of a record is provided, similar to the index of a book. The term is often used synonymously with key file.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The creation of one record type from a hierarchy of record types.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A field through which rapid and/or sorted access to a record is desired.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A file that only contains keys. It may, in fact, contain more than one index because multiple key types can be contained in a single RDM Embedded key file.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The process of performing an ordered traversal through all (or a subset of all) occurrences of a given key field.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A special Domain Name that always refers to the computer on which the application software is running. It is the default domain name used by RDM Embedded utilities and runtime library.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A multi-user database synchronization mechanism, used to prevent simultaneous updates to shared data. Locks can be applied to the entire database or to files.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The process of making a copy of the database changes made during a transaction prior to a commit. Logging is used to support the ability to perform a recovery in the event a failure occurs during a commit.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A relationship between two record types, A and B, such that for each occurrence of type A, there are many related occurrences of type B and, for each occurrence of type B, there are many related occurrences of type A. In RDM Embedded, many-to-many relationships can be implemented using two one-to-many sets through a third, intersection record type.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: Specifies a one-to-many relationship between record types. One occurrence of the owner record type is related to many occurrences of a member record type. Also called a set type.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: Stores set membership linkage information. There is one member pointer stored with a record per set for which the record is a member. Each one contains the database addresses of the owner record, previous member in the set, and next member in the set.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The process of retrieving records from a database by moving through various navigational methods. Methods include set navigation, key scanning, and record-type scanning.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A data representation in which the relationships are explicitly defined and maintained through sets of owner/members, where any given record type may be the owner of multiple types of sets and the member of multiple types of sets. Multiple set membership distinguishes the Network database model from the Hierarchical database model.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A component of a B-tree, consisting of a page of sorted keys stored in a key file.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The elimination of redundant record instances that own a new set, resulting in a one-to-many relationship.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: One record instance within a record type, specifically associated with record type scanning (d_recfrst, d_recnext, d_recprev, d_reclast), where the current occurrence of a record type is used to bookmark the position on a record type scan. Record occurrences are ordered by their physical appearance in a data file. The current occurrence is not the same as the current record, although the current record will also be set by the scanning functions.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: Specifies a one-to-many relationship between record types. One occurrence of the owner record type is related to many occurrences of a member record type. Also called a set type.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: Files are blocked into contiguous fixed-length segments called pages. A page is the unit of database I/O performed in RDM Embedded.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The sequence of directories in a hierarchical file system that must be traversed to locate a particular file.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: In a database, a pointer is data stored in a record occurrence that provides the necessary information for locating related record occurrences. In a C program, a pointer is a variable that contains a memory address.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: Together with an IP address, a port number uniquely identifies an endpoint by which a TCP/IP connection can be made to another program. In RDM Embedded, each server (tfserver, dbmirror, dbrep or dbrepsql) identifies the port number that should be used to locate it. The IP address is normally obtained through a domain name lookup (e.g. tfs.raima.com is a domain name, and its IP address is 198.168.140.200).

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: An independently executing task or program. An individual execution of an RDM Embedded application program.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The placement of fields from one record type into one or more new record types.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A first-in-first-out waiting list. Lock requests for a locked resource will be placed at the end of a queue. When the locked resource becomes available, the first lock request on the queue will be granted.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: Used synonymously with record type or record occurrence depending on the context in which the term is used.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: One individual instance in a database of a record of a particular type. A database consists of many occurrences of many different record types. For example, an employee record type may consist of the fields name, employee_id, job_title, and pay. An employee record occurrence could be "name: Jones, Jim; employee_id: c87101, job_title: engr, pay: 3400".

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The process of completing the transaction of a process that failed during a commit.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: Identical data that is stored in multiple locations in a database. Typically used to form relationships between tables in a relational database management system.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A data representation in which a database is viewed as consisting of two-dimensional tables, each composed of one or more columns. Inter-table relationships are defined through use of common column names and data. Tables and columns are analogous to RDM Embedded records and fields, respectively.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A programming mechanism that makes a library call appear to operate in the program space of an application, even though the actual function exists in the program space of another program (called a "server"). A client application places a function identifier and parameter contents into a packet that is first transferred to the server, with results (return code, return parameter values) transferred back to the caller.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The RDL supplies information to db_REVISE that cannot be derived from a comparison of the source and destination dictionary files.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The top or start node of a B-tree.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A programming mechanism that makes a library call appear to operate in the program space of an application, even though the actual function exists in the program space of another program (called a "server"). A client application places a function identifier and parameter contents into a packet that is first transferred to the server, with results (return code, return parameter values) transferred back to the caller.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The RDM Embedded C language library functions that perform all of the database access required by an application program while it is executing.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A conceptual model of the structure of a database that defines the data contents and relationships. A database definition language specification is an implementation of a particular schema.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: Specifies a one-to-many relationship between record types. One occurrence of the owner record type is related to many occurrences of a member record type. Also called a set type.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: An individual instance of a set in which one owner record occurrence has one or more member record occurrences connected to it.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: Stores set ownership linkage information. There is one set pointer stored with a record per set for which the record is an owner. Each one contains a count of the number of members in the set, the database address of the first member record occurrence, and the database address of the last member record occurrence in the set.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The process of performing an ordered traversal through all (or a subset of all) member record occurrences of a given set occurrence.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A position in a data or key file for storage of a single record or key occurrence.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The database containing the data that is to be revised. This database is used in a read-only manner.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A revision requiring specification by an RDL statement.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The separation of a multiple-member set type into two or more set types.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A revision that can be performed without changing the existing database content or structure.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: The process of ensuring that, in a multi-user database environment, updates to shared data are performed serially, one user at a time.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A special record type used to define the "top" record in a network database. There is only one occurrence of the system record in a database. It is defined by naming "system" as a set owner in one or more set definitions in the DDL. When a database is opened, the system record, if it exists, is set as the current owner of all sets for which it is named as owner. It may not be a set member.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: In an RDM Embedded Application, a task is a block of allocated memory that stores the complete database context for a thread of execution. It must be allocated through the d_opentask function and closed through the d_closetask function. A task represents one user in a multi-user environment. A task can also represent one database transaction, with all locks and database updates associated with the transaction.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A software component within the RDM Embedded system that maintains safe multi-user transactional updates to a set of files, and responds to page requests. The tfserver utility links to the TFS to allow it to run as a separate utility. The TFS may also be linked directly into an application in order to avoid the RPC overhead of calling a separate server.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: An independent flow of control within a computer operating system. Differentiated from a Process in that a process may contain one or more threads. Threads within the same process share common (or global) data but have their own stacks, which keeps track of the thread's context. In RDM Embedded Applications, each thread must be associated with its own task variable, and is treated as a separate user in a multi-user environment.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: An event that occurs when a lock request has waited on a queue longer than a pre-determined amount of time. It is used to avoid deadlock.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A group of related database changes that are written to the database as a single unit during a commit. The logical consistency of a database is maintained by placing all related updates within transactions.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A software component within the RDM Embedded system that maintains safe multi-user transactional updates to a set of files, and responds to page requests. The tfserver utility links to the TFS to allow it to run as a separate utility. The TFS may also be linked directly into an application in order to avoid the RPC overhead of calling a separate server.

a.onclick: FMCDropDown( this ); FMCScrollToVisible( window, this.parentNode.parentNode ); return false;

div.div: A temporary database created by db_REVISE for use only during the database revision process. db_REVISE removes the working database when the revision process is complete.
